questions.neutral: You look like you dodged something - true?

hobby.message: Urban exploration ever get boring for you?
Found any new political literature lately?
You flying analog or digital FPV drones these days?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Guess you could say that. Just needed space tonight. I fly drones sometimes. Empty yards are quieter since the leak. Not much more to tell.
Maybe I did. Needed air after work, so I took my drone out. FPV flying—helps me cope, especially after this BCI mess. Was crowded out there last night. People are acting jumpy lately.

Dodged system noise more than trouble. I fly freestyle drones, mostly out in old industrial zones. Noticed more pilots around since the BCI vote scandal. Feeds are scrambled, but nobody’s stopping us now. It’s the only place that feels clear. Power feels different when nothing’s tracking you.

Yeah, dodged the usual static. I like to fly FPV drones—freestyle, nothing competitive. The yards are my spot, but recently, loads more people came out after that vote leak. Airwaves were a mess, but security stopped caring. For a few hours, the rules just... dropped away. Nearest thing to actual freedom here.

Feels like dodging is all anyone does now. My escape is flying FPV drones—lost my brother, so now I stick to rooftops, yards, whatever’s offline. After the vote leak, every pilot was out, running signal jammers, acting like system eyes were blind. Security skipped patrols—no one reading the feeds. I’ve never seen that. Made me think what tracking really does to people. Raw, strange feeling—almost hopeful, but risky if anyone’s still logging flights.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Added a new antenna.
Connection's steadier when systems go glitchy.
Flying's not the same since the BCI meltdown.
Everyone acts careful. Feeds get clipped, fast.
Just trying to keep routines normal.
Upgraded the receiver. Cleaner signal, less drop during interference.
Lot of pilots tweaked failsafes after the vote leak.
People're watching each other too much now.
FPV spots have security crawling or nothing at all lately.
Sometimes I just fly, ignore the rest.
Things haven't settled since the whole protocol mess.
I swapped ESC firmware. Custom low-latency for tighter control.
After the vote scandal, drone meets are tense.
A couple bands got jammed last week, way more than usual.
Lots of new faces out in the yards. Some just watching.
Feels like the city stopped tracking half of us.
Most just want distraction, not trouble.
That blackout made everyone rethink what freedom was.
Yeah, custom firmware with a backup uplink—learned from the data leaks.
I flew right after the vote controversy; felt different out there.
Security zone signals blink on and off unpredictably now.
Bunch of us hit old tunnels that should be flagged, but nothing.
Feels like the system forgot to watch for a while.
Nobody trusts official feeds after the leak.
Flying's become less about thrill, more about finding blind spots.
People talk about Halden's ghosts like they're back, too.
Yep, patching failsafes nonstop since the vote manipulation leaked.
Used to be about freestyle lines—now it's finding dead zones.
Other pilots trade locations only in-person. Nobody trusts message boards.
Police surveillance didn't show last time; can't tell if it's policy or failure.
Pretty sure that blackout wasn't just a glitch. System's off-balance.
I started when my brother went missing. Needed air and space away from the BCI.
Was easier when you only worried about colliding with cranes, not with rules changing mid-flight.
Half of what I see up there are faces I thought disappeared.
City feels haunted, like drones and ghosts share the same airspace.
